alert.note: Alert for Southwest Carbon County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 02 at 3:16PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wyoming, including the following area, Southwest Carbon County. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Ongoing warm temperatures will continue to produce snowmelt. Heavy rainfall is also possible as early as Wednesday afternoon, and again on Thursday afternoon and evening. The Little Snake River at Dixon is already running at or near bankfull at this time. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
